KH.content: risk of feminizing khōra, a female proper name?
khōra must keep its impropriety, having nothing of its own, this is what we must keep for it
KH.linkedContent: khōra must keep its impropriety, having nothing of its own, this is what we must keep for it

KH.content: khōra can’t receive the female gender she’s given
KH.linkedContent: khōra can’t receive the female gender she’s given

KH.content: khōra is compared to mother & nurse, not part of oppositional couple, 3rd genus, does not belong to “race of women (genos gynaikōn), mother w/out engendering, not an origin, a before signifying no temporal anteriority [intelligible/sensible looks like father/son couple]

KH.content: relation of interval, or the spacing to what is lodged in it to be received
KH.linkedContent: relation of interval, or the spacing to what is lodged in it to be received

GOD.linkedContent: does system of sacrificial responsibility & double “gift of death” require exclusion (sacrifice) of woman? [re: absence of women in Isaac & Abraham story and “Bartleby the Scrivener”]

GOD.content: woman spectacularly absent from scenes of forgiveness btwn father & son
GOD.linkedContent: woman spectacularly absent from scenes of forgiveness btwn father & son

GT.content: the es gibt plays (spielt), play of 4’s as play of gift, manifests the unity of time’s 3 dimensions, la donne de ce jeu [relance], & la doña, la femme qui nous a requis depuis l’exergue [Derrida then mentions a fine book, Finas’ Donne, which interlaces all these themes]

MONL.content: power this ‘alien’ [Oedipus] holds over ‘aliens’: innermost secret, sepulture, in exchange for salvation of city, which he refuses his daughters (refuses them a just ‘work of mourning’)

FK.linkedContent: why have women been the victims of most lethal explosions of ethnico-religious violence in ordeal of unscathed?

BL.content: law is not a woman, not a feminine figure—even if man wants to enter, penetrate it (that’s its trap [makes you think it’s feminine?])
BL.linkedContent: law is not a woman, not a feminine figure—even if man wants to enter, penetrate it (that’s its trap [makes you think it’s feminine?])

LOBL.content: Derrida’s mad hypothesis, nothing to do w/ intention of “author” that the hymen btwn the 2 women in L’arrêt de mort (separated by uncrossable glass partition of 2 stories) is the absolute terror, that they love and approach each other w/out the narrator

SPOM.content: for Marx, there’s a phantomatic objectivity before commodity value [?] product of labor petrifies, erects, hardens (feminine character of commodity-chimera?)
SPOM.linkedContent: for Marx, there’s a phantomatic objectivity before commodity value [?] product of labor petrifies, erects, hardens (feminine character of commodity-chimera?)

POOF.content: via Kant, the deception linked to modesty is moral & egalitarian, creates distance btwn sexes, saves other from degradation, becoming-technical, instrumentalization of jouissance
POOF.linkedContent: via Kant, the deception linked to modesty is moral & egalitarian, creates distance btwn sexes, saves other from degradation, becoming-technical, instrumentalization of jouissance

POOF.content: modesty would get woman to participate in universal fraternity (i.e. humanity), equalizes sexes by moralizing them: modest woman is a brother for man
POOF.linkedContent: modesty would get woman to participate in universal fraternity (i.e. humanity), equalizes sexes by moralizing them: modest woman is a brother for man

POOF.content: woman doesn’t become any less desirable! modesty belongs to history qua fraternization
POOF.linkedContent: woman doesn’t become any less desirable! modesty belongs to history qua fraternization

POOF.content: the double exclusion of feminine related to tension btwn politicization & depoliticization of friendship (tension on the inside of the political itself)
POOF.linkedContent: the double exclusion of feminine related to tension btwn politicization & depoliticization of friendship (tension on the inside of the political itself)

POOF.content: Nietzsche tells us 3x: “woman is not yet capable of friendship”
POOF.linkedContent: Nietzsche tells us 3x: “woman is not yet capable of friendship”

POOF.content: Derrida deduces the political register of friendship in Nietzsche: to be able to honor enemy in friend, a sign of freedom, neither slaves nor tyrants know this freedom > woman is either slave or tyrant, knows only how to love, can’t respect enemy (honor what she doesn’t love); the political translation of Nietzsche’s axiom: friendship is freedom plus equality [the double bind]
POOF.linkedContent: Derrida deduces the political register of friendship in Nietzsche: to be able to honor enemy in friend, a sign of freedom, neither slaves nor tyrants know this freedom > woman is either slave or tyrant, knows only how to love, can’t respect enemy (honor what she doesn’t love); the political translation of Nietzsche’s axiom: friendship is freedom plus equality [the double bind]

POOF.content: for Nietzsche, if woman is not even part of humanity [via inability to befriend], man is not yet man either, men are equally late [Augustine], though woman lagging > be patient in the face of this ‘not yet’: mourned anticipation, a threshold naming—May we have it one day!
POOF.linkedContent: for Nietzsche, if woman is not even part of humanity [via inability to befriend], man is not yet man either, men are equally late [Augustine], though woman lagging > be patient in the face of this ‘not yet’: mourned anticipation, a threshold naming—May we have it one day!

POOF.content: [re: fraternal politics] women don’t have no chance, they have less > hegemony always relation of forces, laws of structure are tendential, impossibility of sheer (plus ou simple) exclusion, account for return of repressed, etc.
POOF.linkedContent: [re: fraternal politics] women don’t have no chance, they have less > hegemony always relation of forces, laws of structure are tendential, impossibility of sheer (plus ou simple) exclusion, account for return of repressed, etc.

HASD.linkedContent: khōra as metaphor—woman (1st strategy); khōra as negative theology (2nd strategy): Derrida favors 2nd strategy because it calls attention to possibility beyond metaphor

PAS.linkedContent: she is the pronoun of a nameless one [see p. (70) here, figure is a he]

PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot: ideal negation, deferred assassination that is language, my language does not kill anyone (woman can always die, her death announced, already present in my language)

PAS.linkedContent: Blanchot come is said so that elle can cry out its name

PPHS.linkedContent: Hegel reassembles the feminine law (singularity, sepulcher, night, the divine) around the pit and the pyramid (feminine law only effective in the underworld not on earth)

PPHS.linkedContent: Hegel: the intuition (of sign), an image which has received (in sich empfangen hat) [like a woman receives in conceiving] as is soul and independent mental representation

SH.content: uniqueness of every hour has its sister, its own, the same, its other revenant
SH.linkedContent: uniqueness of every hour has its sister, its own, the same, its other revenant

WM.content: Diderot: women and poets reason mostly by comparisons
WM.linkedContent: Diderot: women and poets reason mostly by comparisons

SP.content: all Nietzsche’s investigations, especially those of woman > coiled in labyrinth of ear
SP.linkedContent: all Nietzsche’s investigations, especially those of woman > coiled in labyrinth of ear

SP.content: [re: Nietzsche’s “—Distanz!”] hyphen & exclamation mark invite us, by way of pirouette & play of silhouette, to keep distance from veils [woman] that make us dream of death
SP.linkedContent: [re: Nietzsche’s “—Distanz!”] hyphen & exclamation mark invite us, by way of pirouette & play of silhouette, to keep distance from veils [woman] that make us dream of death

SP.content: not only keep your distance from woman, game of seduction, but woman as non-figure, non-identity, distance’s very chasm, interval’s cadence, distance itself [which can’t be said]
SP.linkedContent: not only keep your distance from woman, game of seduction, but woman as non-figure, non-identity, distance’s very chasm, interval’s cadence, distance itself [which can’t be said]

SP.content: woman but one name for untruth of truth, depthless depths that distorts identity, essence, property, brings philosophy to ruin
SP.linkedContent: woman but one name for untruth of truth, depthless depths that distorts identity, essence, property, brings philosophy to ruin

SP.content: Nietzsche: modesty of life, veils: “Yes, life is a woman!” [see p. 59]
SP.linkedContent: Nietzsche: modesty of life, veils: “Yes, life is a woman!” [see p. 59]

SP.content: if woman is truth, she knows there is none, that no one has a place for truth
SP.linkedContent: if woman is truth, she knows there is none, that no one has a place for truth

SP.content: the feminine, that which cannot be pinned down by truth > this should not be mistaken for woman’s femininity, female sexuality, nor an essentializing fetish [for those inexperienced brobags (philosophers, artists) who believe they can capture]
SP.linkedContent: the feminine, that which cannot be pinned down by truth > this should not be mistaken for woman’s femininity, female sexuality, nor an essentializing fetish [for those inexperienced brobags (philosophers, artists) who believe they can capture]

SP.content: skepsis of truth as old as woman herself > skepticism, veiling dissimulation
SP.linkedContent: skepsis of truth as old as woman herself > skepticism, veiling dissimulation

SP.content: via Nietzsche, woman believes in superficiality of existence, disguising pudendum, nothing more than affair of modesty, decency > “truth” nothing but a surface, becomes desirable by way of veil; suspend the veil, or let it fall differently, no longer truth, only “truth”
SP.linkedContent: via Nietzsche, woman believes in superficiality of existence, disguising pudendum, nothing more than affair of modesty, decency > “truth” nothing but a surface, becomes desirable by way of veil; suspend the veil, or let it fall differently, no longer truth, only “truth”

SP.content: woman as suspension of truth & castration > truth-castration as l’affaire de l’homme, his credulity, man is never sufficiently old (assez vieux), dissimulating, or skeptical
SP.linkedContent: woman as suspension of truth & castration > truth-castration as l’affaire de l’homme, his credulity, man is never sufficiently old (assez vieux), dissimulating, or skeptical

SP.content: woman plays w/ castration, does not believe in it, nor its opposite (much too clever for that),  but she can’t seduce w/out it, needs castration’s effects, but as she plays w/ it, she anticipates her laughter (at man)
SP.linkedContent: woman plays w/ castration, does not believe in it, nor its opposite (much too clever for that), but she can’t seduce w/out it, needs castration’s effects, but as she plays w/ it, she anticipates her laughter (at man)

SP.content: were woman to believe in anti-castration, she would return plus sûrement to the same old machine, phallogocentrism’s attendant, disciple discipliné du maître > “we?” should learn from her
SP.linkedContent: were woman to believe in anti-castration, she would return plus sûrement to the same old machine, phallogocentrism’s attendant, disciple discipliné du maître > “we?” should learn from her

SP.content: Nietzsche: can woman really want enlightenment? is she simply looking for new adornment? nothing has been more alien to woman than truth, her great art is the lie
SP.linkedContent: Nietzsche: can woman really want enlightenment? is she simply looking for new adornment? nothing has been more alien to woman than truth, her great art is the lie

SP.content: the double role of woman as truth’s recession, and as the nonbeliever in truth, she is like the Jew in her “delight in dissimulation,” affirmative power
SP.linkedContent: the double role of woman as truth’s recession, and as the nonbeliever in truth, she is like the Jew in her “delight in dissimulation,” affirmative power

SP.content: does Nietzsche refer to Jew because of the way circumcision marks simulation & castration?
SP.linkedContent: does Nietzsche refer to Jew because of the way circumcision marks simulation & castration?

SP.content: one cannot find woman, her femininity, her sexuality, but it is impossible to resist looking for her
SP.linkedContent: one cannot find woman, her femininity, her sexuality, but it is impossible to resist looking for her

SP.content: “what is woman?” is suspended by fact that it is impossible to dissociate [woman, the question of woman] from problematic of truth, art, style
SP.linkedContent: “what is woman?” is suspended by fact that it is impossible to dissociate [woman, the question of woman] from problematic of truth, art, style

SP.content: Hegel on passivity of clittoral pleasure (de la jouissance clitoridienne)
SP.linkedContent: Hegel on passivity of clittoral pleasure (de la jouissance clitoridienne)

SP.content: pratique stylet, pratique stylée, de quel genre? can’t be written w/out conjoined fabulation of woman/truth, entre la femme, in spite of the profundity that is modesty
SP.linkedContent: pratique stylet, pratique stylée, de quel genre? can’t be written w/out conjoined fabulation of woman/truth, entre la femme, in spite of the profundity that is modesty

SP.content: the becoming-woman (becoming Christian) of the idea, the veiling of truth, is the beginning of history, the idea s’éloigne, devient transcendante, inaccessible, séduisante, the dream of death begins (Heidegger avoids this becoming-woman in his own analysis of History of an Error)

SP.content: the becoming-female, Christian, an epoch in parenthesis, a woman castrates and plays at her castration, feigns castration (at once suffered & inflicted) [see HYMEN]
SP.linkedContent: the becoming-female, Christian, an epoch in parenthesis, a woman castrates and plays at her castration, feigns castration (at once suffered & inflicted) [see HYMEN]

SP.content: Nietzsche’s 3 “positions” on woman: 1. woman is figure of falsehood, man as phallus is truth ; man fears castrated woman 2. woman is the figure of truth, plays w/ truth as a fetish ; man fears castrating woman 3. woman as artist, Dionysiac, dissimulatrice, castration doesn’t take place; love affirming woman
SP.linkedContent: Nietzsche’s 3 “positions” on woman: 1. woman is figure of falsehood, man as phallus is truth ; man fears castrated woman 2. woman is the figure of truth, plays w/ truth as a fetish ; man fears castrating woman 3. woman as artist, Dionysiac, dissimulatrice, castration doesn’t take place; love affirming woman

SP.content: no such thing as woman, as truth in itself of woman in itself
SP.linkedContent: no such thing as woman, as truth in itself of woman in itself

SP.content: (das Eigentum des Ab-grundes) the proper-ty of the abyss, the abyss of proper-ty, the reorganization of metaphysics around more powerful question of propriation, question of event (Ereignis) uprooted from ontology, where proper is proper to no one, to nothing: is this what Nietzsche’s woman is, style’s form: the no-where, gift as woman’s essential predicate, appears in undecidable oscillation btwn give/take, se donner/se donner-pour > price/value of pharmakon ——just as there’s no essence of the woman or sexual difference, there’s no essence of es gibt Sein
SP.linkedContent: (das Eigentum des Ab-grundes) the proper-ty of the abyss, the abyss of proper-ty, the reorganization of metaphysics around more powerful question of propriation, question of event (Ereignis) uprooted from ontology, where proper is proper to no one, to nothing: is this what Nietzsche’s woman is, style’s form: the no-where, gift as woman’s essential predicate, appears in undecidable oscillation btwn give/take, se donner/se donner-pour > price/value of pharmakon ——just as there’s no essence of the woman or sexual difference, there’s no essence of es gibt Sein

SP.content: like woman, like writing: il se donne en se dérobant
SP.linkedContent: like woman, like writing: il se donne en se dérobant

SP.content: never has been the style, the woman, the simulacrum, the sexual difference [un gai savoir]
SP.linkedContent: never has been the style, the woman, the simulacrum, the sexual difference [un gai savoir]

SP.content: plus d’un spur, never been the woman > if there’s going to be style, pour que le simulacrum advienne, il faut écrire dans l’écart entre plusieurs styles: anchor lost in abyss btwn—telle est l’échéance

OTO.linkedContent: institutions of “yes,” have need of ears: Nietzsche doesn’t expect the ears and hands for his truths today—my small ears no small interest to ladies, makes me a monster, anti-ass, Anti-Christ

OTO.content: no trace of woman in State education system, she is the great “cripple,” not even attached to the [State] umbilical cord > Derrida does not say this to seduce, a vulgar procedure, and a ubiquitous one, “gynegogy”
OTO.linkedContent: no trace of woman in State education system, she is the great “cripple,” not even attached to the [State] umbilical cord > Derrida does not say this to seduce, a vulgar procedure, and a ubiquitous one, “gynegogy”

OTO.linkedContent: except the mother, there’s a mother in this system (faceless figure, survives on bottom)

ATIA.linkedContent: “the animot is more naked than the human, who is more naked than the animot” > this law governing nudity never resists placing woman/child on side of animal

ATIA.linkedContent: in SW, Derrida analyzed how pubic fleece led Freud into fatality of theoretical delirium

DPi.linkedContent: DP requires a third party, arbitrating authority foreign/superior to parties of dispute, a reason of state, a rationality, logos w/ universal claims > beyond individual passion/affect

DPi.linkedContent: coldness, cruelty, heartless machinism of guillotine, hard and cold like a machine (again juxtaposed to woman, who is apolitical, private, warm)

DPi.linkedContent: Blanchot on putting to death by nomination, annihilating power of names: to say ‘this woman’ gives me the being deprived of being [Blanchot has replaced ‘flower’ w/ ‘woman’]

DPi.content: guillotine made feminine to rhyme w/ machine
though Hugo speaks well of women, we can hear “the classical connotations of this compassionate sympathy”

DST.content: Platonism denounces in mimesis (in désistance) madness, feminization, hysteria

HLP.content: “the earth, she, doesn’t lie” (earthly, feminine, naturalism)

C.linkedContent: rocket of a female orgasm (la fusée d’une jouissance féminine) [?]

TN.linkedContent: Levinas: “equivocation constitutes the epiphany of the feminine”

TN.content: pregnancy, only a woman can feel the heart of another in her; [Derrida to Nancy before surgery] “Don’t worry, I’ll wake up w/ you,” friend who keeps heart of other, this incredible survival > “heart” joins w/ thinking, w/ grace of gratitude, w/ love of friendship

TN.content: apparently, women respond better to heart grafts [?]

ATM.linkedContent: “I am speaking from my place as woman”

ATM.content: as a woman, by reversing dissymmetry [of tout autre in Levinas], Derrida has added rape [alongside other violences: hostage, persecution, etc.]

AD.linkedContent: Levinas: woman, other whose presence is discretely an absence, hospitable welcome par excellence, condition for home, recollection, inhabitation

Aristotle: only under ruler are slaves and women distinguished
BSi.linkedContent: Aristotle: only under ruler are slaves and women distinguished

OG.content: for Rousseau, as dangerous as the supplement is, cohabitation w/ women is even more dangerous, “jouir!” another name for death
OG.linkedContent: for Rousseau, as dangerous as the supplement is, cohabitation w/ women is even more dangerous, “jouir!” another name for death

OG.content: jealousy, a creation of culture, an arresting of nature by woman, stratagem of femininity > invention of culture denatures pity [which should reach out to every living thing]
OG.linkedContent: jealousy, a creation of culture, an arresting of nature by woman, stratagem of femininity > invention of culture denatures pity [which should reach out to every living thing]

OG.content: jealousy marks the gap btwn pity/love
Rousseau: woman’s commands are caresses, her threats are tears, she manages the commander
OG.linkedContent: Rousseau: woman’s commands are caresses, her threats are tears, she manages the commander

OG.content: women turn men into women, but the contest (partie) is not equal, perhaps most profound signification du jeu de la supplémentaire
OG.linkedContent: women turn men into women, but the contest (partie) is not equal, perhaps most profound signification du jeu de la supplémentaire

OG.content: acc. Rousseau, women force men to love one theme, one representation, they turn men into women
OG.linkedContent: acc. Rousseau, women force men to love one theme, one representation, they turn men into women

OG.content: physical love urges sexes to union, moral love (which is immoral) fixes desire on particular object
OG.linkedContent: physical love urges sexes to union, moral love (which is immoral) fixes desire on particular object

OG.content: for Rousseau, “moral love” reflects history as denaturalization, this moral supplement is nothing, but still causes preference, forces force
OG.linkedContent: for Rousseau, “moral love” reflects history as denaturalization, this moral supplement is nothing, but still causes preference, forces force

OG.content: [vis-à-vis Rousseau] history also protects/resists abyss of evil > “moral love” (which is immoral, acc. Rousseau) becomes modesty (true morality of women)
OG.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Rousseau] history also protects/resists abyss of evil > “moral love” (which is immoral, acc. Rousseau) becomes modesty (true morality of women)

OG.content: Nietzsche & Rousseau share same opinion of women (degradation of culture), and of genealogy of morals as servitude to slave—so how could Nietzsche have hated him so much?
OG.linkedContent: Nietzsche & Rousseau share same opinion of women (degradation of culture), and of genealogy of morals as servitude to slave—so how could Nietzsche have hated him so much?

OG.content: acc. Rousseau, “moral love” not biology but power of imagination > all depravity of culture related to possession of women (movement of preference/difference)
OG.linkedContent: acc. Rousseau, “moral love” not biology but power of imagination > all depravity of culture related to possession of women (movement of preference/difference)

IF.content: for Flaubert, women always mix something useful or pleasant w/ beauty (thus don’t experience it)
IF.linkedContent: for Flaubert, women always mix something useful or pleasant w/ beauty (thus don’t experience it)

IF.content: Flaubert desires male sentences, taut, muscular
IF.linkedContent: Flaubert desires male sentences, taut, muscular

EU.content: [vis-à-vis Descartes] link drawn btwn using vulgar language and “facility” for women
EU.linkedContent: [vis-à-vis Descartes] link drawn btwn using vulgar language and “facility” for women

EU.content: Descartes and feminism: intelligible order has no sexual marks [cogito is “desexed,” w/out body, sexually neutral or indifferent]
EU.linkedContent: Descartes and feminism: intelligible order has no sexual marks [cogito is “desexed,” w/out body, sexually neutral or indifferent]

EU.content: which is feminist: learn Latin? or be talked down to in vulgar language?
EU.linkedContent: which is feminist: learn Latin? or be talked down to in vulgar language?

SPEC.content: woman perpetuates race by risking the name: analytic “movement” as genealogy of son-in-law, Judaic law
SPEC.linkedContent: woman perpetuates race by risking the name: analytic “movement” as genealogy of son-in-law, Judaic law

FV.content: Schreber: we all (women included) like naked women
FV.linkedContent: Schreber: we all (women included) like naked women

FV.content: for Freud, dreams of nakedness don’t exhibit penis or absence of penis but absence of phallus, absence of attribute supplementing a possible fault, absence of colossal double > following chain is indicated: truth-unveiled-woman-castration-shame [Schreber]
FV.linkedContent: for Freud, dreams of nakedness don’t exhibit penis or absence of penis but absence of phallus, absence of attribute supplementing a possible fault, absence of colossal double > following chain is indicated: truth-unveiled-woman-castration-shame [Schreber]

FV.content: “Seminar” insists on topos, single proper itinerary of letter, if meaning [in the general sense] is indifferent to letter, meaning of the letter is not, meaning of letter as truth itself
FV.linkedContent: “Seminar” insists on topos, single proper itinerary of letter, if meaning [in the general sense] is indifferent to letter, meaning of the letter is not, meaning of letter as truth itself

FV.content: not naive topology but still a topos, Heideggerian-like veiled/unveiled castration placed at the hole (trou) of the woman, letter comes back to Being, to the nothing that is the opening btwn woman’s legs (Queen)
FV.linkedContent: not naive topology but still a topos, Heideggerian-like veiled/unveiled castration placed at the hole (trou) of the woman, letter comes back to Being, to the nothing that is the opening btwn woman’s legs (Queen)

FV.content: Derrida on Lacan: circulation, acquitting of a debt, a proper place [not naive, empirical topology], detour from [woman’s] hole to itself permits signified to return to its origin—indivisible locality, signifier must never be lost, divided, fragmented
FV.linkedContent: Derrida on Lacan: circulation, acquitting of a debt, a proper place [not naive, empirical topology], detour from [woman’s] hole to itself permits signified to return to its origin—indivisible locality, signifier must never be lost, divided, fragmented

FV.content: circular itinerary, Dupin, analyst, find letter where they expect it: Queen wants letter-fetish brought back to her, exchange one fetish for another w/out spending because there’s equivalence: restricted economy, circle, stricture
FV.linkedContent: circular itinerary, Dupin, analyst, find letter where they expect it: Queen wants letter-fetish brought back to her, exchange one fetish for another w/out spending because there’s equivalence: restricted economy, circle, stricture

FV.content: castration, truth, signifier, fetish, bring phallus back into oikos ring
FV.linkedContent: castration, truth, signifier, fetish, bring phallus back into oikos ring

FV.content: the lack never lacks a place: indivisible circulation of proper
FV.linkedContent: the lack never lacks a place: indivisible circulation of proper

FV.content: lack does not have its place in dissemination
FV.linkedContent: lack does not have its place in dissemination

FV.content: for Lacan, Femininity is the Truth (of) castration, best figure of castration, because in logic of signifier it (elle) has always already been castrated > Femininity “leaves” something in circulation (here the letter), detaches something she never had, brought back to itself
FV.linkedContent: for Lacan, Femininity is the Truth (of) castration, best figure of castration, because in logic of signifier it (elle) has always already been castrated > Femininity “leaves” something in circulation (here the letter), detaches something she never had, brought back to itself

FV.content: this 1st castration (pre-castration) affects w/ castration/femininity whoever holds the letter
FV.linkedContent: this 1st castration (pre-castration) affects w/ castration/femininity whoever holds the letter

FV.content: analyst has seen what no one else has: place of the thing btwn the legs
FV.linkedContent: analyst has seen what no one else has: place of the thing btwn the legs

FV.content: Dupin’s feminization: possess the letter [?] > letter has one place, occupied by all those who possess it
FV.linkedContent: Dupin’s feminization: possess the letter [?] > letter has one place, occupied by all those who possess it

FV.content: [in Purloined Letter] Queen wishes to play on 2 contracts [must be read elsewhere?]: Queen’s desire to retain (garder) or refind the letter doubles her pact w/ the King
FV.linkedContent: [in Purloined Letter] Queen wishes to play on 2 contracts [must be read elsewhere?]: Queen’s desire to retain (garder) or refind the letter doubles her pact w/ the King

FV.content: indestructibility of letter functions as pact binding 2 “singularities,” excludes all double simulacra: [in Lacan] subject is very divided, but phallus is not to be cut > at origin/end, there’s a word that doesn’t trick: the truth of the lure [p. 466n indivisibility in repetition compulsion]
FV.linkedContent: indestructibility of letter functions as pact binding 2 “singularities,” excludes all double simulacra: [in Lacan] subject is very divided, but phallus is not to be cut > at origin/end, there’s a word that doesn’t trick: the truth of the lure [p. 466n indivisibility in repetition compulsion]

FV.content: all phallogocentrism articulated based on (individual, perceptual, cultural, historical) situation where phallus is mother’s desire (to the extent she doesn’t have it) > though phallus isn’t the organ, it mostly symbolizes the penis > thus, phallogocentrism as androcentrism & woman as absolute Other
FV.linkedContent: all phallogocentrism articulated based on (individual, perceptual, cultural, historical) situation where phallus is mother’s desire (to the extent she doesn’t have it) > though phallus isn’t the organ, it mostly symbolizes the penis > thus, phallogocentrism as androcentrism & woman as absolute Other

FV.content: [re: psychoanalysis] institution built on male child’s experience > at stage of genital organization, there’s only maleness (antithesis isn’t femaleness but being castrated): phallogocentrism is no accident/error, its old, enormous root must be accounted for [described] > but, its description is a “participant” when it induces a practice, ethics, institution, a politics that insures truth of a tradition
FV.linkedContent: [re: psychoanalysis] institution built on male child’s experience > at stage of genital organization, there’s only maleness (antithesis isn’t femaleness but being castrated): phallogocentrism is no accident/error, its old, enormous root must be accounted for [described] > but, its description is a “participant” when it induces a practice, ethics, institution, a politics that insures truth of a tradition

WBH.content: to say woman is not a “subject,” 2 consequences: 1) radically revolutionary or deconstructive 2) dangerously reactive
WBH.linkedContent: to say woman is not a “subject,” 2 consequences: 1) radically revolutionary or deconstructive 2) dangerously reactive

WBH.content: to say women are subjects keeps whole framework on which traditional university is built
WBH.linkedContent: to say women are subjects keeps whole framework on which traditional university is built

WBH.content: to say woman is on side of undecidability has only meaning of strategical phase, the side of woman becomes the side from which you begin to dismantle structure > but, as soon as you reach first stage of deconstruction, opposition man/woman no longer pertinent
WBH.linkedContent: to say woman is on side of undecidability has only meaning of strategical phase, the side of woman becomes the side from which you begin to dismantle structure > but, as soon as you reach first stage of deconstruction, opposition man/woman no longer pertinent

WBH.content: “woman” no longer best trope to refer to these things, same goes for undecidability itself!
WBH.linkedContent: “woman” no longer best trope to refer to these things, same goes for undecidability itself!

WBH.content: there’re many undecidables, one undecidability acts as a program, programming or unprogramming a program
WBH.linkedContent: there’re many undecidables, one undecidability acts as a program, programming or unprogramming a program

WBH.content: “woman” as “truth,” as that which stops the drift, but what about truth as movement of the drift [?]
WBH.linkedContent: “woman” as “truth,” as that which stops the drift, but what about truth as movement of the drift [?]

CHOR.content: [quoted from SP] that which will not be pinned down by truth, is, in truth, feminine, but this should not be mistaken for woman’s femininity, nor female sexuality, by dogmatic philosopher, impotent artist, or inexperienced seducer still hoping to capture
CHOR.linkedContent: [quoted from SP] that which will not be pinned down by truth, is, in truth, feminine, but this should not be mistaken for woman’s femininity, nor female sexuality, by dogmatic philosopher, impotent artist, or inexperienced seducer still hoping to capture

CHOR.content: to say ironically, “there is no one place for woman,” is neither anti-feminist nor feminist, is faithful to affirmative displacement: “dancing” of women
CHOR.linkedContent: to say ironically, “there is no one place for woman,” is neither anti-feminist nor feminist, is faithful to affirmative displacement: “dancing” of women

CHOR.content: “essentializing fetishes” (truth, femininity, essentiality of woman or feminine sexuality as fetishes)—but one must be precise about fetishism [i.e. general fetishism in Glas], and its context, if only to displace it
CHOR.linkedContent: “essentializing fetishes” (truth, femininity, essentiality of woman or feminine sexuality as fetishes)—but one must be precise about fetishism [i.e. general fetishism in Glas], and its context, if only to displace it

CHOR.content: [cf. WBH p. 198] could femininity, however irreducible it may be, remain derived from or subordinated to question of destination or thought of gift?
CHOR.linkedContent: [cf. WBH p. 198] could femininity, however irreducible it may be, remain derived from or subordinated to question of destination or thought of gift?

CHOR.content: new “concept” of woman? was there ever an old one? [deconstruct concept of concept]
CHOR.linkedContent: new “concept” of woman? was there ever an old one? [deconstruct concept of concept]

CHOR.content: “hymen,” “invagination,” part of Derrida’s attempt to re-sexualize philosophical/theoretical discourse, but these terms no longer simply designate figures of feminine body: what remains undecidable concerns [but not only] line of cleavage btwn 2 sexes
CHOR.linkedContent: “hymen,” “invagination,” part of Derrida’s attempt to re-sexualize philosophical/theoretical discourse, but these terms no longer simply designate figures of feminine body: what remains undecidable concerns [but not only] line of cleavage btwn 2 sexes

CHOR.content: hymen does not exist, anything constituting value of existence is foreign to “hymen,” so how could one then attribute existence of hymen properly to woman? (same goes for invagination)
CHOR.linkedContent: hymen does not exist, anything constituting value of existence is foreign to “hymen,” so how could one then attribute existence of hymen properly to woman? (same goes for invagination)

CHOR.content: invagination is always taken w/in syntax of expression “double chiasmatic invagination of borders,” doubly folded, redoubled, inversed: can we still recognize “representation of woman” in this movement?
CHOR.linkedContent: invagination is always taken w/in syntax of expression “double chiasmatic invagination of borders,” doubly folded, redoubled, inversed: can we still recognize “representation of woman” in this movement?

CHOR.content: questions of representation [of women] always too old & as yet to be born, overloaded w/ hieroglyphs & still as virgin as origin, like early morning in East
CHOR.linkedContent: questions of representation [of women] always too old & as yet to be born, overloaded w/ hieroglyphs & still as virgin as origin, like early morning in East
